holidays.name: March Fourth Movement Day
holidays.description: Commemorates the student-led protest in China in 1919 against the Treaty of Versailles' decision to transfer German-held Chinese territories to Japan, sparking nationalism and political activism.
holidays.funFact: The March Fourth Movement inspired later influential political movements in China, including the May Fourth Movement, which was pivotal in modern Chinese history.

holidays.name: National Grammar Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate and promote the importance of good grammar, punctuation, and clear writing‚Äîbecause proper commas save lives!
holidays.origin: Started by Martha Brockenbrough and the Society for the Promotion of Good Grammar in 2008
holidays.funFact: The hashtag #NationalGrammarDay trends annually as grammar enthusiasts share humorous grammar fails and tips.

holidays.name: Frozen Food Day
holidays.description: A frozen tribute to the convenience and innovation of food preservation, celebrating the magic of freezing to keep meals fresh and ready!
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday in the United States, recognized to honor Clarence Birdseye's frozen food process
holidays.funFact: Clarence Birdseye‚Äôs invention of flash freezing in the 1920s revolutionized how people eat, making frozen food a kitchen staple worldwide.

holidays.name: March 4th Be With You Day
holidays.description: A quirky pop culture nod to the iconic line from Star Wars 'May the Force be with you.' Since March 4th sounds like 'May the Force,' fans celebrate early!
holidays.origin: Unofficial fan-created celebration inspired by the Star Wars fandom
holidays.funFact: Star Wars fans use March 4th to show off early Jedi costumes and share memes before the more famous May 4th 'Star Wars Day.'
